attributes.action: Extend a higher basic personal tax allowance to everyone under 75.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To counteract the loss of the 10% tax band, I propose that the current arrangements for those aged 65-74 be extended to everyone below 75.

Those with high incomes won't gain as there is an income limit above which the increased allowance decreases by £1 for every £2 above the limit (currently £21,800).

It would especially help low income workers who are unable to, or for whom it is difficult to claim Working Tax Credit for whatever reason (certain part-timers, workers with no children, self-employed with fluctuating income etc) and women of 60-64 who have officially reached state retirement age and are receiving a modest personal or company pension in addition to their State Pension.

If set at the right level, the gains in actual income from an increased tax allowance could replace Working Tax Credit and would certainly be easier to calculate accurately.
